p: Patients 1, 4, 5, and 6 decreased their L-DOPA equivalent daily dose (LEDD) at year 4 compared with baseline. In patients 3 and 7, 4th year LEDD increased, and in patient 2 remained unchanged compared with baseline ( Table 3). In the fourth year all patients except patient 1, improved on UPDRS III OFF as compared with the baseline ( Fig. 4) and patients 2, 6, and 7 improved as compared with both baseline and the second year after surgery. Patients 2 and 7, while retaining improvement as compared with the baseline, by the fourth year reversed a certain deterioration observed at the first and second years after surgery.
